body: It looks like the problem here is that we currently don't support the (*) syntax for enum struct variants.
I just tried it with both `adt::CEnum(_, _)` and `adt::CEnum(min, max)` and unfortunately both variants lead to the same error. The star pattern does not seem to be the culprit here.
Looks like the fail!() in enum_variants has been present since the initial commit in 727c7c74994cf54baecab8ab6b03c50ace44d634. Feel free to look into fixing that :)

``` rust
struct Exe {
    action: Action,
}

enum Action {
    Check { code: bool },
}

fn main () {}
```

also exhibits the error (from #6362), backtrace:

I think this issue can be closed now with PR #7557 being merged into master.
The reason why the crash only occurred so infrequently was that `typeck::check::mod::check_enum_variants()` also filled the `VariantInfo` cache and this function already supported struct-style enums for some time. Consequently, the crash only occurred when `ty::enum_variants()` was called for an enum that had not been type checked before, and this seems to be the case quite rarely.

Hey @michaelwoerister, just a tip: if you put the text "closes #7557." (Or "fixes #...") in [a commit message](https://github.com/blog/1386-closing-issues-via-commit-messages) or [the text of a pull request](https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests), then github will automatically close that issue when that commit/pull request gets merged.
@huonw: That's a nice feature. Thanks for telling me about it :)
